primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preacher presents a narrative where the believer must initiate effort and works to activate God's provision of an 'open door' (opportunity, success, and status).

tekstueel_bewijs: If you've got the faith, you can walk in.

object.identificatie: The Open Door (Success, Education, Social Status, Spirituality)
tekstueel_bewijs: steps of holiness and powers of consecration
I read nowhere where it says, Find and then seek. It says very clearly, 'Seek, and ye shall find'.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer (as the one who earns/receives the door)
tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord takes the yearnings of our heart... and accepts that.
The Lord can and will open doors for you.

tegenstander.identificatie: Social obscurity, poverty, and human critics
tekstueel_bewijs: never mind what anybody says about you
twenty devils or twenty thousand cannot keep you down
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The 'opponents' are primarily horizontal: people who say 'you can't' or the threat of being 'unnoticed' by history.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's cosmic victory over death and hell.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Jesus Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The Keys of Hell and Death
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The cosmic power of Christ (Primary Program in Scripture) is used here as a rhetorical 'guarantee' for the hearer's personal success (Secondary Program).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He performs miracles in our lives.
I have set before thee an open door.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: If you've got the faith, you can walk in.

voorbeelden: We must know that this is no neophyte speaking.
what we are willing to attempt
sincere desire to be well pleasing
If I can ever understand the gospel, I will believe.
If the Lord says you can, you can!

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the obligation of the human subject to act first (Devoir) to trigger the divine power (Pouvoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the fear of Oblivion (~S1) to the requirement of Effort (S1) to reach the Open Door.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in human 'trying' which God then 'accepts' as success.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Low; S2 is defined as social obscurity rather than spiritual death or judgment.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly reverses the order of grace, stating that human effort must precede divine opening.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Our effort must come first. That is faith.
If you've got the faith, you can walk in.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I have set before thee an open door.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David and the Preacher's own life are used as models of how 'trying' leads to God opening doors.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God preserves Philadelphia despite their 'little strength' solely because of His faithfulness to His name.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform/try harder to ensure God 'opens the door'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is contingent upon human 'willingness to attempt'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon starts with Christ's power but shifts to a 'quid pro quo' logic of human effort.
spanning_punten: The text says 'I have set' (Perfect tense, completed action), but the preacher says 'Our effort must come first'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Think how much worse we would be if it were not for Jesus Christ.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not mentioned as the source of 'Pouvoir'; rather, the human 'Vouloir' (will) is the engine.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is treated as 'being bad' or 'rough', rather than a state of death.
hamartologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christians not being as good as they ought... how much worse we would be.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a motivational speech where God is a 'Helper' to the human 'Subject' who seeks social and personal advancement.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'seeking', 'knocking', and 'effort'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who opens the door precisely because the hearer has 'little strength'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because you are weak and cannot open the door, Christ has already opened it for you.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the 'little strength' of the Philadelphians as the reason for grace, not their 'works'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: POUVOIR (Christ's power given to the weak)
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Replace 'Our effort must come first' with 'Christ's gift comes first'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Define the 'shut door' as Sin and Death which no human effort can budge.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Only a heavy opponent justifies a Divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (trying) is placed before Soteriology (the door).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ opens the door (Grace). 2. We walk through (Response).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has high rhetorical energy but structurally undermines the Gospel of Grace by making human effort the prerequisite for divine action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is encouraging; actantially, it is a burden of performance.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis shows the door is opened by Christ's authority; the sermon claims it is opened by our knocking.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite using the name of 'Jesus', the 'Subject' of the engine is 'Me'.

volledige_subject_lijst: You and I will never do enough
appendices.notities: The sermon contains a blatant theological error: 'I read nowhere where it says, It shall be open unto you, then knock.' In fact, the text of Rev 3:8 says the door is ALREADY set/opened before the works are mentioned.
